Class Piece

Constructor Detail

Piece

public Piece(int x,
             int y,
             java.lang.String name,
             boolean team,
             javax.swing.ImageIcon img,
             int id)
This method initalizes all the different kinds of pieces.

Parameters:
x - position on the board
y - position on the board
name - of the kind of piece
team - a boolean that is true if the piece is white and false if the piece is black
img - the image of the piece
Method Detail

addMove

public void addMove()
Increments the number of moves the piece has taken by one.

ascend

public boolean ascend(int y)
This method should only be overwritten in the Pawn class. This method ascends a Pawn to a queen.

Parameters:
y - coordinate on the board
Returns:
a true value if it is possible for a pawn to ascend

castle

public boolean castle(int a,
                      int b,
                      Piece rook)
This method is only should be overwritten in the King class. This method checks if the King and respective Rook are capable of castling.

Parameters:
a - the x value where the king is moving.
b - the y value where the king is moving.
rook - that is going to be moved along with the king.
Returns:
a true value if it is possible to castle.

check

public boolean check(int a,
                     int b)
This method should only be overwritten in the King class. Checks to see if the king is in check.

Parameters:
a - the x coordinate on the board
b - the y coordinate on the board
Returns:
a true value if the King is in check or a false value if the King is not in check

checkMate

public boolean checkMate()
This method should only be overwritten in the King class. Checks to see if a king is in checkmate.

Returns:
a true value if the King is in checkmate or a flase value if the King is not in checkmate.

enpassant

public boolean enpassant(int a,
                         int b,
                         Piece opp)
This method should only be overwritten in the Pawn class. This method checks to see if a pawn can perform an enpassant.

Parameters:
a - the x value where the pawn is to move to.
b - the y value where the pawn is to move to.
left - the Piece object to the left of the pawn.
right - the Piece object to the right of the pawn.

getTeam

public boolean getTeam()
Gets the color of the piece.

Returns:

getValidMove

public abstract boolean getValidMove(int a,
                                     int b,
                                     Piece opponent)
Checks if the move chosen is valid.

Parameters:
a - the x coordinate where the piece is moving to.
b - the y coordinate where the piece is moving to.
opponent - the occupant of that space.
Returns:
a boolean value if the the move is possible for a certain kind of piece

Returns:

getY

public int getY()
Gets the Y coordinate of the piece.

Returns:

kingCheck

public void kingCheck()
This method should only be overwritten in the King class. This method assists with checking to see if a King is in check or checkmate. It checks to see if the King truely is in check or Checkmate. Also checks to see if the player who is in checkmate has any possible move to get out and if so determines that it is not checkmate.

move

public void move(Location a)
Moves the piece to a location.

Parameters:
a - A Location object which represents a location on the board
